title: Do practical marks combine to pass in the class 12th board exam? - Quora
tags: Central Board of Secondary Education, India

response.answer_text: From 2018, the Central Board of Secondary Education has relaxed the passing criteria for Class 10 students. The students need to get a minimum of 33 per cent marks in theory and practical combined to declare pass in the subject. This means there will be no need for them to secure 33 per cent separately in both board exams and internal assessments. However, the board has not revised the passing marks for Class 12 examinations. To pass in Class 12 examinations, one has to clear both theoretical and practical paper separately with minimum 33% marks each.

Yes Practical marks combine to pass or fail in 12th board exam. You have to pass both in theory as well as in practical. If you passed in theory but failed in practical you will we declared fail. On the other hand if you failed in theory and paased in practical then also you declared failed. But don't much bother about practicals if you attempts the practical in right way you will definitely pass the practical exam.
In overall percentage it will combine but in order to pass u will have to pass in theory too along with practicals.
Yes practical marks are combined to pass in 12th Board Exam. You need to pass in theory as well as practical exams both. Both marks will be considered as marks obtained in that paper.
Obviously ,the practical marks are taken together along with the written exam marks.
For passing you have to pass separately. Practical marks included for percentage.
Yes they do….and is important to clear boards with good marks.
